intro: Ctenodon lyonnetii, commonly known as the Lyonnet's ctenodon, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ctenophoraceae and is characterized by its unique, spirally arranged leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
